result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A Arguelles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
IF REVOKED: Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: eachother

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED TO ALL COSTS.
Buy money of $220.00 to be forwarded to Waukesha Co. Drug Metro Unit.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Any prescriptions are to be prescribed through the same pharmacy.
Notify doctors of this case.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - 1 day credit. STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. ALL COSTS PAID IN FULL.
